result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel Jay Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Release for Day Reporting Center ONLY. Court notes an objection to electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: any other sentence, with credit for 7 days time served

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges during the course of probation to the probation agent, cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or combination of both.

No firearms; weapons.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.
No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia or objects.

Defendant is eligible for dosage probation.
Maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
Defendant to attend at least 1 sobriety support group per week.
Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
Provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay surcharge.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation the Court stays condition time of 75 days, without good time credit, no release privileges, Court notes and objection to electronic monitoring, to be imposed by the Department of Corrections as follow: 15 days for a 1st positive drug or alcohol test, 25 days for a 2nd positive drug or alcohol test, 35 days for a 3rd positive drug or alcohol test.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel Jay Hill

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samuel Jay Hill in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Jury Trial. Case proceeds to Plea and Sentencing. 

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information. Judgment of conviction entered.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

Defendant sentenced to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, release for Day Reporting Center ONLY, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 7 days time served.  Court notes an objection to electronic monitoring. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-  Defendant is eligible for dosage probation. 
-  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
   use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
-  Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment
   including drug and alcohol testing. 
-  Defendant to attend at least 1 sobriety support group 
   per week. 
-  Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
   medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
-  No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia or objects
   to conceal or hide drug paraphernalia. 
-  No firearms; weapons
-  Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or
   combination of both.
-  As a condition of probation the Court imposes and stays 
   condition time of 75 days, without good time credit, no release 
   privileges, Court notes and objection to electronic monitoring, 
   to be imposed by the Department of Corrections as follow: 
       *15 days for a 1st positive drug or alcohol test,
       * 25 days for a 2nd postive drug or alcohol test, 
       * 35 days for a 3rd positive drug or alcohol test. 
-  Provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay surcharge; 
-  Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges during the course
   of probation to the probation agent, cash bail to apply. 
    Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due
    immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.

 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. 
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated August 5, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant Samuel Jay Hill in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Samuel Jay Hill in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj. Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
